title: River Weaver Way Walking Route

images.title: Roger  Kidd / Private canal moorings at Audlem, Cheshire
images.caption: Private canal moorings at Audlem, Cheshire. Seen below Lock No 13 of the flight of fifteen. There are plenty of visitor moorings available on the towpath side of the canal in Audlem, but it can be a crowded and popular place in the summer. The Shropshire Union Canal was opened in 1835 and is 66.5 miles long. The engineer was Thomas Telford.

images.title: Roger  Kidd / Nantwich Aqueduct, Shropshire Union Canal, Cheshire
images.caption: Nantwich Aqueduct, Shropshire Union Canal, Cheshire. The canal is built on a long embankment as it skirts Nantwich. Here it crosses the A534 road.

images.title: Espresso Addict / Gate lodge of Dorfold Hall, near Acton
images.caption: Gate lodge of Dorfold Hall, near the canal at Acton, Nantwich. Grade-II-listed Victorian building in Jacobean style, in red brick with stone dressings. The lodge and gates date from 1862, when the grounds of Dorfold Hall were remodelled by Wilbraham Spencer Tollemache. The stone plaques bear the Tollemache diamond and cross emblem. The A534 (Chester Road) into Nantwich is on the left.

images.title: Rept0n1x, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Weaver at Winsford.

images.title: Lizzie / The locks, Northwich
images.caption: The locks, Northwich. The locks along the Weaver Navigation with the railway arches in the background.

images.title: David Quinn / River Weaver near Frodsham
images.caption: River Weaver near Frodsham. The Weaver is approximately 52miles long between Peckforton and Audlem to near Runcorn.

images.title: Sue Adair / River Weaver near Little Leigh
images.caption: River Weaver near Little Leigh

description: Follow the Weaver Way through Cheshire from Audlem to Frodsham on this delightful 40 mile walk. This route is ideal if you enjoy waterside walking, with long stretches along the Trent and Mersey Canal and Shropshire Union Canal as well as along the River Weaver Navigation. Watch out for a variety of wildlife along the way including March hares, Canada Geese and Kingfishers. Towns on the route include Winsford , Northwich and Nantwich .
